scenes.background: [Monica] starts explaining the unexpected issues. [Bob] listens, still visibly upset.
scenes.description: 'Monica, can you walk us through the steps you took? Maybe we missed something.'

options.text: Bob, do you think there's a specific point we need to focus on?
options.analysis: You shifted the focus back to Bob, acknowledging his emotions and involving him in the problem-solving process, showing good perception and social skills.

options.text: Monica, could you also highlight any support you might need from us?
options.analysis: You asked Monica to identify her needs, showing empathy, but overall engagement and motivation to resolve the issue collaboratively were moderate.

options.text: Let's focus on actionable items. We can't afford to waste time. Monica, summarize quickly.
options.analysis: You aimed to keep the discussion efficient, demonstrating strong self-regulation, but lower empathy and motivation to address the problem collaboratively.
